001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JavaType;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode;
006import org.slf4j.Logger;
007import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
008
009import javax.net.ssl.HttpsURLConnection;
010import javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory;
011import java.io.IOException;
012import java.io.InputStream;
013import java.io.OutputStream;
014import java.net.HttpURLConnection;
015import java.net.URI;
016import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
017
018/**
019 * JSON-RPC Client using {@link HttpURLConnection} formerly named{@code RpcClient}.
020 * <p>
021 * This is a concrete class with generic JSON-RPC functionality, it implements the abstract
022 * method {@link AbstractRpcClient#sendRequestForResponse(JsonRpcRequest, JavaType)} using {@link HttpURLConnection}.
023 * <p>
024 * Uses strongly-typed POJOs representing {@link JsonRpcRequest} and {@link JsonRpcResponse}. The
025 * response object uses a parameterized type for the object that is the actual JSON-RPC `result`.
026 * Using strong types and Jackson to serialize/deserialize to/from strongly-typed POJO's without
027 * using intermediate `Map` or `JsonNode` types.
028 *
029 */
030public class JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection extends AbstractRpcClient {
031    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection.class);
032    private final URI serverURI;
033    private final String username;
034    private final String password;
035    private static final String UTF8 = StandardCharsets.UTF_8.name();
036    private final SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory;
037    
038    public JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection(SSLSocketFactory socketFactory, JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion, URI server, final String rpcUser, final String rpcPassword) {
039        super(jsonRpcVersion);
040        this.sslSocketFactory = socketFactory;
041        log.debug("Constructing JSON-RPC client for: {}", server);
042        this.serverURI = server;
043        this.username = rpcUser;
044        this.password = rpcPassword;
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * Construct a JSON-RPC client from URI, username, and password
049     *
050     * @param jsonRpcVersion version for {@code jsonrpc} field in messages
051     * @param server server URI should not contain username/password
052     * @param rpcUser username for the RPC HTTP connection
053     * @param rpcPassword password for the RPC HTTP connection
054     */
055    public JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection(JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion, URI server, final String rpcUser, final String rpcPassword) {
056        this((SSLSocketFactory) SSLSocketFactory.getDefault(), jsonRpcVersion, server, rpcUser, rpcPassword);
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * Get the URI of the server this client connects to
061     * @return Server URI
062     */
063    @Override
064    public URI getServerURI() {
065        return serverURI;
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Send a JSON-RPC request to the server and return a JSON-RPC response.
070     *
071     * @param request JSON-RPC request
072     * @param responseType Response type to deserialize to
073     * @return JSON-RPC response
074     * @throws IOException when thrown by the underlying HttpURLConnection
075     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException when the HTTP response code is other than 200
076     */
077    @Override
078    public <R> JsonRpcResponse<R> sendRequestForResponse(JsonRpcRequest request, JavaType responseType) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
079        HttpURLConnection connection = openConnection();
080
081        // TODO: Make sure HTTP keep-alive will work
082        // See: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/net/http-keepalive.html
083        // http://developer.android.com/reference/java/net/HttpURLConnection.html
084        // http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2011/09/androids-http-clients.html
085
086        if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
087            log.debug("JsonRpcRequest: {}", mapper.writeValueAsString(request));
088        }
089        
090        try (OutputStream requestStream = connection.getOutputStream()) {
091            mapper.writeValue(requestStream, request);
092        }
093
094        int responseCode = connection.getResponseCode();
095        log.debug("HTTP Response code: {}", responseCode);
096
097        if (responseCode != 200) {
098            handleBadResponseCode(responseCode, connection);
099        }
100
101        JsonRpcResponse<R> responseJson = responseFromStream(connection.getInputStream(), responseType);
102        connection.disconnect();
103        return responseJson;
104    }
105
106    private <R> JsonRpcResponse<R> responseFromStream(InputStream inputStream, JavaType responseType) throws IOException {
107        JsonRpcResponse<R> responseJson;
108        try {
109            if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
110                // If logging enabled, copy InputStream to string and log
111                String responseBody = convertStreamToString(inputStream);
112                log.debug("Response Body: {}", responseBody);
113                responseJson = mapper.readValue(responseBody, responseType);
114            } else {
115                // Otherwise convert directly to responseType
116                responseJson = mapper.readValue(inputStream, responseType);
117            }
118        } catch (JsonProcessingException e) {
119            log.error("JsonProcessingException: {}", e);
120            // TODO: Map to some kind of JsonRPC exception similar to JsonRPCStatusException
121            throw e;
122        }
123        return responseJson;
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Prepare and throw JsonRPCStatusException with all relevant info
128     * @param responseCode Non-success response code
129     * @param connection the current connection
130     * @throws IOException IO Error
131     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException An exception containing the HTTP status code and a message
132     */
133    private void handleBadResponseCode(int responseCode, HttpURLConnection connection) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException
134    {
135        String responseMessage = connection.getResponseMessage();
136        String exceptionMessage = responseMessage;
137        int jsonRpcCode = 0;
138        JsonRpcResponse bodyJson = null;    // Body as JSON if available
139        String bodyString = null;           // Body as String if not JSON
140        InputStream errorStream = connection.getErrorStream();
141        if (errorStream != null) {
142            if (connection.getContentType().equals("application/json")) {
143                JavaType genericResponseType = mapper.getTypeFactory().
144                        constructParametricType(JsonRpcResponse.class, JsonNode.class);
145                // We got a JSON error response -- try to parse it as a JsonRpcResponse
146                bodyJson = responseFromStream(errorStream, genericResponseType);
147                JsonRpcError error = bodyJson.getError();
148                if (error != null) {
149                    // If there's a more specific message in the JSON use it instead.
150                    exceptionMessage = error.getMessage();
151                    jsonRpcCode = error.getCode();
152                    // Since this is an error at the JSON level, let's log it with `debug` level and
153                    // let the higher-level software decide whether to log it as `error` or not.
154                    // i.e. The higher-level software can set error level on this module to `warn` and then
155                    // decide whether to log this "error" not based upon the JsonRpcStatusException thrown.
156                    // An example occurs in Bitcoin when a client is waiting for a server to initialize
157                    // and returns 'Still scanning.. at block 530006 of 548850'
158                    log.debug("json error code: {}, message: {}", jsonRpcCode, exceptionMessage);
159                }
160            } else {
161                // No JSON, read response body as string
162                bodyString = convertStreamToString(errorStream);
163                log.error("error string: {}", bodyString);
164                errorStream.close();
165            }
166        }
167        throw new JsonRpcStatusException(exceptionMessage, responseCode, responseMessage, jsonRpcCode, bodyString, bodyJson);
168    }
169
170    private static String convertStreamToString(java.io.InputStream is) {
171        java.util.Scanner s = new java.util.Scanner(is, UTF8).useDelimiter("\\A");
172        return s.hasNext() ? s.next() : "";
173    }
174
175    private HttpURLConnection openConnection() throws IOException {
176        HttpURLConnection connection =  (HttpURLConnection) serverURI.toURL().openConnection();
177        if (connection instanceof HttpsURLConnection) {
178            ((HttpsURLConnection) connection).setSSLSocketFactory(this.sslSocketFactory);
179        }
180        connection.setDoOutput(true); // For writes
181        connection.setRequestMethod("POST");
182        connection.setRequestProperty("Accept-Charset", UTF8);
183        connection.setRequestProperty("Content-Type", "application/json;charset=" +  UTF8);
184        connection.setRequestProperty("Connection", "close");   // Avoid EOFException: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19641374/android-eofexception-when-using-httpurlconnection-headers
185
186        String auth = username + ":" + password;
187        String basicAuth = "Basic " + base64Encode(auth);
188        connection.setRequestProperty ("Authorization", basicAuth);
189
190        return connection;
191    }
192}
